text: Well, I was at work one day I was doing my usual job working on the warehouse floor stocking boxes organizing merchandise
keypoint: Working in the warehouse, organizing and stocking

text: I had been working for a few hours it was getting late I had been feeling a bit strange a bit lightheaded
keypoint: Feeling strange and lightheaded as it gets late

text: but chalked it up to hunger not having eaten yet that day
keypoint: Assuming hunger due to not eating

text: But then, as I was walking around the warehouse returning items to their proper places I started to feel a strange tightness and pressure in my chest
I stopped what I was doing leaned against a nearby wall for a bit the pressure only got stronger I could feel my heart pounding in my chest
keypoint: Stopping work as pressure and heart pounding increase

text: Next thing I know, I started seeing spots I could feel sweat dripping down my forehead my arms I tried to take some deep breaths I just couldn't catch my breath
keypoint: Seeing spots, sweating, and struggling to breathe

text: I was really scared didn't know what to do.
keypoint: Feeling scared and unsure of what to do

text: Suddenly I heard a voice coming from across the warehouse. It was the manager who had seen me called out to me it seems someone had noticed me was checking to see if I was alright
keypoint: Manager notices and checks on the situation

text: I tried to yell back that something was wrong I couldn't find my voice.
keypoint: Unable to call out for help

text: The manager started walking towards me I could feel my world going dark I started to drop to the ground luckily the manager got to me in time caught me just before my legs gave out
keypoint: Manager reaches and supports as I collapse

text: He took me to the staff room sat me down in a chair He asked me questions about what was wrong what happened
keypoint: Manager takes me to staff room and questions me

text: He got me a glass of cold water told me to rest for a bit
keypoint: Given water and told to rest

text: After a few minutes the pressure in my chest slowly eased up I started to feel better
It turned out I had been having a panic attack I escaped from the situation the help of the quick action of the manager
keypoint: Realizing it was a panic attack, manager helped

text: It was never a fun experience it really could have been much worse
it taught me to check in with myself make sure to properly rest eat to avoid further episodes
keypoint: Learning to rest and eat to prevent episodes
